revised_title: Chemical Analysis of Irradiated Ergosterol and its Implications
tldr: The author discusses the chemistry of irradiated ergosterol, a substance that is converted into an antirachitic substance, presumably identical to vitamin D, when exposed to ultraviolet rays. The study focuses on the physical and chemical properties of the irradiation product, its behavior with digitonin, the presence of the hydroxyl group, molecular weight, double bonds, and stability. The author concludes that the vitamin D is an isomeride of ergosterol and contains a system of conjugated double bonds.
